item.description:
William Shakespear'es Romantic Comedy - Twelfth Night
Directed by: Ellen Lieberman
Connecticut Free Shakespeare


Come on down and picnic, or join us for the performance at 8:00.

Moonstruck Lovers, passions, hidden identities, practical jokes, wacky sword fights, comic revenge, happily ever after!

The Zoo’s Picnic Grove opens at 6:30 p.m. for people to enjoy picnic dinners brought from home, or purchased from the Zoo’s concession stands. People are also welcome to bring blankets and lawn chairs. The Zoo itself will not be open for touring during the evening.

http://www.ctfreeshak...
203-393-3213
In the case of inclement weather, the show will be postponed until the next listed performance.


A FEW SELECT REVIEWS:
(For more visit our news page!)

- "Celebrating their 10th anniversary...", Theater Circut, Rosaline Friedman, July 23, 2009

- "A Merry 'Midsummer' Night in Bridgeport", The Norwalk Hour, David Rosenberg , July 22, 2009

- "'A Midsummer Night's Dream' - Staged at the Zoo & Guilford Green", Middletown Press, Bonnie Goldberg, July 30, 2009

- "'Much Ado About Nothing' Theater Review", Irene Bakalanic, July 31, 2008

- "'Much Ado About SOMETHING'", A Review from An Audience member, Ken ----, July 27, 2008

“'Love’s Labour’s Lost' Found at the Zoo”, Joanne Rochman, Hometown Press, July 25, 2007.

- “Shakespeare meets ‘Animal House’ –Rollicking Love’s Labours Lost Lights up Green”, Robert C. Pollack, Shoreline Times, August 15, 2007.
